ground_truth_bugs.description: Webhook header case sensitivity - CALCOM_WEBHOOK_HEADER_NAME with uppercase chars will fail lookup
Invalid Zod schema syntax - computed keys [z.string().toString()] don't work in z.object()
Hardcoded 'refresh_token' string when refresh_token is missing from response
parseRefreshTokenResponse returns safeParse result {success,data,error} instead of parsed data
Salesforce CalendarService missing prisma import - ReferenceError on token refresh
Salesforce uses stale credentialKey.access_token after refresh instead of refreshed token
zoho-bigin passes credentialId instead of userId to refreshOAuthTokens
refreshOAuthTokens returns fetch Response when sync enabled, but callers expect token object
GoogleCalendarService res?.data is undefined when sync endpoint used (Response has no .data)

notes.overlap_analysis: Bugs 2, 3, 4 are covered by both droid and golden. Droid comment 2699764747 covers multiple issues in parseRefreshTokenResponse (bugs 2, 3, 4). Golden comments 4 and 5 both describe the same fundamental issue (bug 8 and 9) - the return type mismatch in refreshOAuthTokens.
notes.droid_strengths: Droid caught the missing prisma import (critical runtime error), stale token usage in Salesforce, credentialId/userId mismatch in zoho-bigin, and header case sensitivity - all specific, actionable bugs with clear fixes.
notes.golden_strengths: Golden correctly identified the Response vs token object mismatch in refreshOAuthTokens which affects multiple callers when credential sync is enabled.
notes.coverage_gap: Droid missed the refreshOAuthTokens return type issue when credential sync is enabled. Golden missed the header case sensitivity, missing import, stale token usage, and userId mismatch bugs.
